types.name: Node
types.description: An object with a globally unique ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

types.name: ReindexType
types.description:
A custom type defined in the app. Normally created by
creating a migration with the CLI tool.

See: [Reindex tutorial: Defining the schema
](https://www.reindex.io/docs/tutorial/defining-the-schema/)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of the type. (Only "OBJECT" is currently supported.)

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the type.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the type.

fields.name: interfaces
fields.description: The names of interfaces the type implements. (Only "Node" is currently supported.)

fields.name: fields
fields.description: A list of fields for the type.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: All the permissions defined for this type.

fields.name: pluralName
fields.description: An optional pluralized name for the type. If not specified, the default English pluralization will be used for field names like `allStories`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: ReindexField
types.description: A field of a custom type.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The return type of the field

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the field.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the GraphQL field.

fields.name: nonNull
fields.description: Defines whether this field will be non-null in the output type.

fields.name: builtin
fields.description: True for builtin fields defined by the system.

fields.name: deprecationReason
fields.description: If set, makes the field show as deprecated.

fields.name: ofType
fields.description: The inner type for a Connection or List field.

fields.name: reverseName
fields.description: For Connection and Node fields, the name of the related field in the connected type.

fields.name: grantPermissions
fields.description: For fields of type `User`, the permissions granted to the user connected using this field.

fields.name: defaultOrdering
fields.description: Default ordering (for a connection field).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ReindexPermissionSet
types.description: A set of granted permissions.

fields.name: read
fields.description: If true, grants a read permission.

fields.name: create
fields.description: If true, grants a create permission.

fields.name: update
fields.description: If true, grants an update permission.

fields.name: delete
fields.description: If true, grants a delete permission.

types.name: ReindexOrdering
types.description: A sort ordering, consist of a name of a field and an order (ascending/descending).

fields.name: order
fields.description: A sorting order, either ASC or DESC.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The name of the field the result is sorted by.

types.name: ReindexOrder
types.description: A sort order (ascending/descending).

fields.name: count
fields.description: The total number of nodes included in the connection.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A plain list of ReindexPermission objects without the ReindexPermissionEdge wrapper object.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges included in the connection.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information used by the client for paginating the connection.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^53 - 1) and 2^53 - 1 since represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specifiedby [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ReindexPermission
types.description: A create/read/update/delete permission to a specific type. Can be granted to a specific `user`, or as a wildcard permission to all users by setting user to `null`.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user the permission is granted to.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type the permission applies to.

fields.name: read
fields.description: If true, grants a read permission.

fields.name: create
fields.description: If true, grants a create permission.

fields.name: update
fields.description: If true, grants an update permission.

fields.name: delete
fields.description: If true, grants a delete permission.

types.name: ReindexSecret
types.description: Stores a secret used for signing authentication tokens for an app.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

fields.name: value
fields.description: A long secret string used for signing authentication tokens.

types.name: ReindexAuthenticationProvider
types.description:
An authentication provider includes the settings for an
authentication method used for signup and login.

Currently supported providers are:
* Facebook (provider type `facebook`)
* Google (provider type `google`)
* Twitter (provider type `twitter`)
* GitHub (provider type `github`)

See also:
[Reindex tutorial: Authentication
](https://www.reindex.io/docs/tutorial/authentication/)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The provider type (e.g. facebook).

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: The client ID for the application (e.g. for the `facebook` provider this is `Facebook App ID` of the Facebook app used for authentication.

fields.name: clientSecret
fields.description: The client secret for the application (e.g. for the `facebook` provider this is the `Facebook App Secret` of the Facebook app used for authentication.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: Must be set to `true` to enable user authentication using this provider.

types.name: ReindexProviderType
types.description: Defines the type of authentication service.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: The client mutation ID used by clients like Relay to track the mutation. If given, returned in the response payload of the mutation.

types.name: _CompanyPayload
types.description: The payload returned from mutations of `Company`.

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The client mutation ID used by clients like Relay to track the mutation. If given, returned in the response payload of the mutation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the mutated object.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description:
The global viewer object. Can be used in the client to add
a newly created object to the connection of all objects of
the type.

E.g. when creating a Company object, you can add it
to `viewer.allCompanies` using the following Relay
mutation config:
```javascript
{
  type: 'RANGE_ADD',
  parentID: this.props.viewer.id,
  connectionName: 'allCompanies',
  edgeName: 'changedCompanyEdge',
  rangeBehaviors: {
    '': 'prepend',
  },
}
```

fields.name: changedCompany
fields.description: The the mutated object.

fields.name: changedCompanyEdge
fields.description: A connection edge containing the mutated object. Can be used to add a newly created object to a connection.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: The client mutation ID used by clients like Relay to track the mutation. If given, returned in the response payload of the mutation.

fields.name: viewer

The global viewer object. Can be used in the client to add
a newly created object to the connection of all objects of
the type.

E.g. when creating a Todo object, you can add it
to `viewer.allTodos` using the following Relay
mutation config:
```javascript
{
  type: 'RANGE_ADD',
  parentID: this.props.viewer.id,
  connectionName: 'allTodos',
  edgeName: 'changedTodoEdge',
  rangeBehaviors: {
    '': 'prepend',
  },
}
```

```javascript
}
```

fields.name: clientMutationId
fields.description: The client mutation ID used by clients like Relay to track the mutation. If given, returned in the response payload of the mutation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the mutated object.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description:
The global viewer object. Can be used in the client to add
a newly created object to the connection of all objects of
the type.

E.g. when creating a Speaker object, you can add it
to `viewer.allSpeakers` using the following Relay
mutation config:
```javascript
{
  type: 'RANGE_ADD',
  parentID: this.props.viewer.id,
  connectionName: 'allSpeakers',
  edgeName: 'changedSpeakerEdge',
  rangeBehaviors: {
    '': 'prepend',
  },
}
```

fields.name: changedSpeakerEdge
fields.description: A connection edge containing the mutated object. Can be used to add a newly created object to a connection.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the deleted object.

types.name: ReindexMigrationCommand
types.description: A migration command. This type is never created directly, but returned as a result from calling `migrate`, typically using the `reindex schema-push` command in the CLI.

fields.name: commandType
fields.description: A type of a migration command, e.g. "CreateField".

fields.name: isDestructive
fields.description: Boolean indicating whether this is a destructive command, i.e. whether running it may permanently delete data.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human readable description of the command.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query and mutation operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directives provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
